page.title: 06Education Norboro'CP School
page.content: In May 1985 The Times Educational Supplement chose Northborough School as an example of good primary practice and wrote a feature on the school. It was one of only six schools chosen from the whole country. As children we are given a lot of personal autonomy. We sometimes get the chance to go down to the dining room to copy up best work. We are famous for the presentation of our work. We have been invited to take part in a number of exhibitions and many handwriting competitions like The East of England Show. We are very proud of our facilities like the pond. Some of the children pay 65p a day to eat school dinners, which they have in the dining room, but most children have sandwiches in their classrooms. Of 176 children at school, only 3 regularly go home for dinner.
